intro: Tithymalus cupanii, commonly known as the cupani's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
